page.title: 08Offord and Buckden Mill
page.content: It seems that mills have existed on or near the site for over a thousand years.Two mills were mentioned in the {Domesday Book}of 1086.About a hundred years ago the mill was a busy place. Local farmers took their corn there by cart,waggon or barge and the flour was returned the same way.When the railway came the river became less important for transport and a horse tramway was built to the railway line. You can still see the tramway to-day. After many years of business there was a slump and the mill was closed in 1965.It was then used as a{corn drying {plant and warehouse}for grain.This also closed four years ago.Now it is used by{agricultural merchants.
